Checkers
Class Board

java.lang.Object
  Checkers.Board

public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

This represents a game state. It contains a current checkerboard with all pieces marked, a note on whose turn it is, and a counter of how many moves have been played. It also provides action primitives for moves and jumps, but these are for board manipulation only and are not to be used by Solver classes.

Field Detail

board

public int[][] board
The board itself. Key: 0 - Empty space 1 - P1 piece 2 - P1 king -1 - P2 piece -2 - P2 king

Method Detail

reset

protected void reset()
Resets the board to the initial state.

move

protected Board move(int i,
                     int j,
                     int iInc,
                     int jInc)
Tries to move the piece at (i,j) to (i+iInc, j+jInc).

Parameters:
i - The y coord of the piece
j - The x coord of the piece
iInc - The y increment of the move (+/- 1)
jInc - The y increment of the move (+/- 1)
Returns:
The new board state if move occurred, null else.

jump

protected Board jump(int i,
                     int j,
                     int iInc,
                     int jInc)
Tries to jump the piece at (i+iInc,j+jInc) using the piece at (i, j).

Parameters:
i - The y coord of the piece
j - The x coord of the piece
iInc - The y increment of the move (+/- 1)
jInc - The y increment of the move (+/- 1)
Returns:
The new board state if jump occurred, null else.

printBoard

public void printBoard()
This prints the board using red and black pieces Key: r: p1 piece R: p1 king b: p2 piece B: p2 king

p1win

public boolean p1win()
Sees whether all of p2's pieces have been eliminated.

Returns:
true if no pieces of p2 remain, false else

p2win

public boolean p2win()
Sees whether all of p1's pieces have been eliminated.

Returns:
true if no pieces of p1 remain, false else
